intro: Aquilegia laramiensis, commonly known as the Laramie columbine, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its showy, spurred petals that come in shades of blue, purple, and white. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly habitats, often in mountainous regions. It has palmate leaves with three to five leaflets and produces seed pods that split open to release seeds. Aquilegia laramiensis is adapted to high-altitude environments and is often found in alpine meadows.
